Steel is 100% recyclable and can be reused indefinitely.
Aluminum is one of the most lightweight and corrosion-resistant metals.
Concrete is the most widely used man-made material in the world.
Wood can absorb carbon dioxide, making it eco-friendly for construction.
Glass can be recycled endlessly without loss of quality.
Copper is highly conductive, making it ideal for electrical wiring.
Plastic can take up to 500 years to decompose in landfills.
Titanium is as strong as steel but 45% lighter.
Brick is one of the oldest building materials, dating back to 7000 BC.
Rubber can be made from both natural latex and synthetic materials.
